description: This source file defines a FirebaseService class that manages initialization of Firebase in a Flutter application. It handles asynchronous initialization, guards against multiple initializations, and checks for placeholder configuration values.

classes.name: FirebaseService
classes.description: A utility class providing centralized Firebase initialization management with static methods and properties, ensuring Firebase is initialized properly in the app lifecycle.

methods.name: FirebaseService._
methods.description: Private constructor to prevent instantiation, indicating the class is used as a static utility.

methods.name: FirebaseService.isInitialized
methods.description: Getter that returns whether Firebase has been successfully initialized.

methods.name: FirebaseService.ensureInitialized
methods.description: Asynchronous method that initializes Firebase if not already initialized, with safeguards against multiple calls and handling placeholder configurations.

methods.name: FirebaseService._isPlaceholderOptions
methods.description: Helper method to detect placeholder Firebase options by checking for sentinel 'TODO' values.
